EU ready to ease position to reach trade agreement with US before deadline
subhead: After another round of consultations with member states on Monday, the European Commission hopes to present a proposal on Wednesday, even though Washington has postponed the introduction of increased tariffs to August 1 in the absence of a deal.

title: Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.
byline: By Julia Pascual (Boulogne-sur-Mer, Dunkirk and Loon-Plage special correspondent)

title: 'Negotiating with Donald Trump is like playing chess with a pigeon'
subhead: By torpedoing the fledgling 15% international corporate tax, the president of the United States has shattered hopes for a fairer world by only benefitting American multinationals, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Mbappé drops criminal complaint against PSG as talks take place behind the scenes
subhead: Seeking an agreement over the €55 million in salary and bonuses that Paris Saint-Germain has refused to pay him, Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappé on Monday withdrew a criminal complaint filed in May against his former employer. He continues to pursue his claims before the labor tribunal.

title: Deadly floods in Texas put Republicans on the defensive: 'It was an act of God, not the administration'
subhead: More than 100 people, including 28 children from a Christian summer camp, lost their lives in catastrophic floods. According to 'The New York Times,' many National Weather Service positions in Texas were vacant and warning systems failed in the state.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
subhead: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.
byline: By Apostolis Fotiadis, Lola Hierro and Ludek Stavinoha

title: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
subhead: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.
byline: By Forough Alaei (Photos) and Audrey Delaporte

title: Tax on ultra-rich: 'France has the opportunity to lead the way,' say Nobel Prize-winning economists
subhead: As public deficits balloon and extreme wealth explode, creating a minimum tax on the assets of billionaires should be a priority, argue seven Nobel Prize-winning economists in an op-ed for Le Monde.
